4 Tersangka Penyuap Bupati Bengkayang Segera Disidang
01 Nov 2019, 20:02 by Ibnu Hariyanto
Jakarta - KPK merampungkan proses penyidikan terhadap empat tersangka terkait kasus dugaan suap Bupati Bengkayang, Suryadman Gidot. Keempat tersangka itu segera disidang.
"Penyidikan untuk empat tersangka dalam perkara suap terkait proyek pekerjaan di Pemerintah Kabupaten Bengkayang, Kalimantan Barat tahun 2019 telah selesai. Hari ini Penyidik menyerahkan tersangka, berkas, dan barang bukti ke penuntutan," kata Kabiro Humas KPK Febri Diansyah kepada wartawan, Jumat (1/11/2019).
Keempat tersangka tersebut yakni Rodi, Yosef, Bun Sifat dan Nelly Margaretha. Keempatnya diduga sebagai pemberi dalam kasus ini.
Febri mengatakan persidangan akan dilaksanakan di Pengadilan Tipikor Pontianak. Febri menjelaskan dalam proses penyidikan keempat tersangka itu total ada 100 saksi yang dimintai keterangan. Saksi-saksi itu berasal dari berbagai unsur mulai dari Wakil Bupati Bengkayang, sejumlah pejabat di lingkungan Pemkab Bengkayang hingga pihak swasta.
Dalam kasus ini, KPK menetapkan Suryadman sebagai tersangka karena diduga menerima suap. Dia diduga menerima suap Rp 340 juta dari sejumlah pihak swasta lewat Kepala Dinas PUPR Bengkayang Alexius.
"Pada Senin, 2 September 2019, AKS (Alexius) menerima setoran tunai dari beberapa rekanan proyek yang menyepakati fee sebagaimana disebut sebelumnya, terkait dengan paket pekerjaan penunjukan langsung melalui FJ (Fitri Julihardi selaku staf honorer pada Dinas PUPR) dengan rincian sebagai berikut: Rp 120 juta dari BF (Bun Si Fat), Rp 160 juta dari PS (Pandus), YF (Yosef), dan RD (Rodi), serta Rp 60 juta dari NM (Nelly Margaretha)," kata Wakil Ketua KPK Basaria Pandjaitan di gedung KPK, Jalan Kuningan Persada, Jakarta Selatan, Rabu (4/9).
Selain Suryadman, KPK menjerat Alexius selaku Kepala Dinas PUPR Pemkab Bengkayang sebagai tersangka. Keduanya diduga menerima suap dari lima orang pengusaha bernama Rodi, Yosef, Nelly Margaretha, Bun Si Fat, dan Pandus, yang semuanya ditetapkan sebagai tersangka pemberi.

4 Suspect Bribe Regent Bengkayang Immediately Tried
01 Nov 2019, 20:02 by Ibnu Hariyanto
Jakarta - The Corruption Eradication Commission (KPK) has completed a process of investigating four suspects related to the alleged bribery case of the Bengkayang Regent, Suryadman Gidot. The four suspects were immediately tried.
"Investigations for four suspects in bribery cases related to work projects in the Bengkayang Regency Government, West Kalimantan in 2019 have been completed. Today Investigators hand over suspects, files and evidence to the prosecution," KPK Kabiro PR spokesman Febri Diansyah told reporters on Friday (1 / 11/2019).
The four suspects are Rodi, Joseph, Bun Properties and Nelly Margaretha. All four were suspected as givers in this case.
Febri said the trial would take place in the Pontianak Corruption Court. Febri explained that in the investigation process of the four suspects a total of 100 witnesses were questioned. The witnesses came from various elements ranging from the Deputy Regent of Bengkayang, a number of officials in the Bengkayang Regency Government to the private sector.
In this case, the KPK named Suryadman a suspect for allegedly taking bribes. He is suspected of receiving a bribe of Rp. 340 million from a number of private parties through the Head of PUPR Bengkayang Office Alexius.
"On Monday, September 2, 2019, AKS (Alexius) received a cash deposit from several project partners who agreed to the fee as mentioned earlier, related to the appointment package directly through FJ (Fitri Julihardi as honorary staff at the PUPR Office) with the following details: Rp 120 million from BF (Bun Si Fat), Rp 160 million from PS (Pandus), YF (Yosef), and RD (Rodi), and Rp 60 million from NM (Nelly Margaretha), "said KPK Deputy Chairman Basaria Pandjaitan in the building KPK, Jalan Kuningan Persada, South Jakarta, Wednesday (4/9).
In addition to Suryadman, the KPK ensnared Alexius as the Head of the PUPR Regency of Bengkayang Regency as a suspect. Both were suspected of accepting bribes from five businessmen named Rodi, Joseph, Nelly Margaretha, Bun Si Fat, and Pandus, all of whom were named suspects as givers.
